segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, stretching as high as he can to reach the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s so determined, but that stool looks like it’s about to collapse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is right there, waiting for her share, completely trusting him not to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman hasn’t turned around yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, drying that plate like nothing’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is everywhere, and she doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever going to notice the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are going to get in so much trouble if she catches them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But right now, they’re getting away with it, and it’s kind of funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn’t fall—it would ruin the whole moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene is pure chaos, and I’m here for it.
segments.speaker: PAR
